channel.title: Help me with java problems please--
channel.description:
I have been having a problem with the command prompts of server run-files opening and closing very fast.
In one server's "read me" i saw this
"Click on run.bat and the WouhaScape Client starts.
if it opens and closes fast then you gotta download a jdk kid of java which can be downloaded here:
http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
use the 6 update 10 or other what say
The Java SE Runtime Environment (JRE) allows end-users to run Java applications.
have fun"
----------------------
I went to java, and I don't know which to choose. Also how can i connect that specifically to work correctly? Anyone have hints?

item.title: Help me with java problems please--
item.dc:creator: @snowballman3 snowballman3
item.description:
@snowballman3 wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:15, topic:251120”]@snowballman3, the folder that starts with jdk. It should be something like jdk1.6.0_10

@Jordiescape, Yes. I know, but i’m feeling kind. :)[/quote]

I know, you said replace the jdk1.6.0_11 with what name?

Read full topic
item.source: Help me with java problems please--

item.title: Help me with java problems please--
item.dc:creator: @snowballman3 snowballman3
item.description:
@snowballman3 wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:12, topic:251120”][quote author=supra s link=topic=331380.msg2588134#msg2588134 date=1229626218]

add a ‘pause’ to the end of the bat file. Then check the error. -.-

again horribel wronge …

try this :

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

check if you client has a file called EGUI otherwile change it to client

supra ~
[/quote]
You can’t even spell wrong, or horrible. Also, he didn’t say what error he had, so i told him to put a pause there so he could post the error he’s getting. So i was right you moron.

add a ‘pause’ to the end of the bat file. Then check the error. -.-

again horribel wronge …

try this :

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

check if you client has a file called EGUI otherwile change it to client

supra ~

Now it can’t find the path specified

use this then i told you dued … read

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m client 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

Wrong. He said…

Now it can’t find the path specified

That means it can’t find C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe. You’re the biggest idiot i’ve ever encountered.

@snowballman3, Goto C:\Program Files\Java\ Find your JDK folder and replace the ‘jdk1.6.0_07’ with the folder name.[/quote][quote=“x blitz x, post:12, topic:251120”][quote author=supra s link=topic=331380.msg2588134#msg2588134 date=1229626218]

add a ‘pause’ to the end of the bat file. Then check the error. -.-

again horribel wronge …

try this :

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

check if you client has a file called EGUI otherwile change it to client

supra ~
[/quote]
You can’t even spell wrong, or horrible. Also, he didn’t say what error he had, so i told him to put a pause there so he could post the error he’s getting. So i was right you moron.

add a ‘pause’ to the end of the bat file. Then check the error. -.-

again horribel wronge …

try this :

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

check if you client has a file called EGUI otherwile change it to client

supra ~

Now it can’t find the path specified

use this then i told you dued … read

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m client 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

Wrong. He said…

Now it can’t find the path specified

That means it can’t find C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe. You’re the biggest idiot i’ve ever encountered.

@snowballman3, Goto C:\Program Files\Java\ Find your JDK folder and replace the ‘jdk1.6.0_07’ with the folder name.[/quote]

Sorry, replace it with which folder name?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“supra s, post:9, topic:251120”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=331380.msg2587977#msg2587977 date=1229620390]
add a ‘pause’ to the end of the bat file. Then check the error. -.-
[/quote]

again horribel wronge …

try this :

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

check if you client has a file called EGUI otherwile change it to client

supra ~[/quote]
You can’t even spell wrong, or horrible. Also, he didn’t say what error he had, so i told him to put a pause there so he could post the error he’s getting. So i was right you moron.

[quote=“supra s, post:11, topic:251120”][quote author=snowballman3 link=topic=331380.msg2588189#msg2588189 date=1229628182]

add a ‘pause’ to the end of the bat file. Then check the error. -.-

again horribel wronge …

try this :

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause

check if you client has a file called EGUI otherwile change it to client

supra ~

Now it can’t find the path specified
[/quote]

use this then i told you dued … read

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe” -Xmx500m client 0 0 lowmem members 0
pause[/quote]
Wrong. He said…

Now it can't find the path specified
That means it can't find C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\java.exe. You're the biggest idiot i've ever encountered.

@snowballman3, Goto C:\Program Files\Java\ Find your JDK folder and replace the ‘jdk1.6.0_07’ with the folder name.
